<NEW>

There was a small bare trace of a smile from LEO PRIME as he nodded to
TUSCON, "Of course." he said quietly, silently wondering if the twins
would remember the scenerio with the same version and details as
TUSCON did.

He reached down to his console and sent RAT TRAP, STRAIGHTSHOT and
WHEELIE a request to appear at the meeting room just off the bridge.

Looking at TUSCON as he shut down the viewscreen. "I have directed
them to the ready room." LEO said as he turned to face TUSCON. "The
doctors will be having more patients soon enough and will need the
medical bay." Another small smile, "And I would think that the ready
room would have a more proffesional air to it than this room does."

(TAG)

Preston



On 8/25/11, Sandy Panico <magicquartz@...> wrote:
> Tucson looks to Leo with seriousness but with an air of professional calm.
>
> " In this case, I feel it's best to meet them all at once.  This scenario
> happened to me at one time and of all mechs I had to get tangled up with, it
> happened to be Sunstreaker and Sideswipe.  At the time they felt that they
> were the hot shots of the Autobot faction and they felt I was just another
> slow moving, fuel hungry off roader, like Trail Breaker, Hound, Beach Comber
> and even Ratchet.  Although they had the spark to ridicule Ratchet behind
> his back, it was another story when he was around them.  "
>
> He sighs.
>
> " Ratchet and I had a lot in common, mostly our short tempers and low
> tolerance for ridicule by fellow soldiers.  That too was something I got
> ridiculed for.  One day they went too far with their snide commentary and I
> got into a severe altercation with the two of them.  I'm not proud of this
> mind you, but I can't deny that it happened.  The fight ended with
> considerable damage to me and the two of them, but more so to them.  Ultra
> Magnus had to literally pry me off of them because of the strength advantage
> I had over them.  It wasn't long before we were all brought to Optimus Prime
> due to our dispute that I admit that I started, and he was not happy with
> all three of us.  He did not discriminate against any of us and gave us our
> reprimands as equals all at the same time.  He then told us that the lesson
> to be learned was that we needed to work as a team if we're ever to get over
> our differences.  The brothers were not thrilled about that and neither was
> I .  But we still did as we were instructed, we worked together during a
> weeks time, learning how to cooperate and learn about who we really were on
> the inside.  We never thought it would work until.."
>
> He gives a sigh.
>
> It was during one of our famous battles on Cybertron, we were under heavy
> fire by the Seekers and and they were much faster in flight than we were on
> wheels.  Side Swipe was on my left and Sunstreaker was on my right, a good
> distance ahead.  I tried to keep up with them but at the time my alt form
> was more suited for strength rather than speed.  It took only one shot from
> the seekers to destroy the road ahead of me, taking the twins with it.  At
> that time our differences meant nothing to me and I quicky shifted into
> robot mode, while still in motion, mind you, I slid on my chest for a good
> twenty feet, reached out and caught their back bumpers just before the fell
> hood first into a large bottomless void, created by the seekers.  They
> quickly transformed but I still held onto them.  As soon as they turned
> around, I retained my position so they could climb to safety.  I was never
> in so much pain in my life after that but for the first time, they were
> extremely thankful for what I had done, and they apologized for all the
> ridicule they inflicted on me and so I did the same and we shook hands.
> After that, we embraced each other, thankful we all made it out in one
> piece.  I have a feeling the same could be so with my sister, Rattrap and
> Wheelie.  But they may need more than just a week."
>
> Perpetually on the move and constantly busy.
>
> On Aug 25, 2011, at 9:42 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
>> LEO PRIME glanced over at his console as it beeped at him. "Wheelie
>> has arrived in at the Ark again. Did you want to see them one at a
>> time or together?"
>>
>> LEO was letting TUSCON run his troops again, but he was still keeping
>> an optic open to be sure that he would be the leader they would need.
>> Perhaps a leader who thought 'out of the box' so to speak would be
>> good. But too far out of the box could get them all killed. And there
>> was still the matter of TUSCON's anger.
>>
>> Yes, LEO PRIME still continued to watch TUSCON's way of commanding,
>> hoping that he would prove to be the leader the Maximals needed.
>> Meanwhile he still kept the call out for all Maximals to return to the
>> ark, there were other groups out there still returning.
>>
>> (TAG)
>>
>> Preston
>>
>
